title: 111_s345
content: The Act titled "Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2009" expands its scope to include coral conservation. It amends the previous act to encompass protection for both forests and coral reefs. Any references to the old act now refer to the new expanded version. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include protection for coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. The changes involve striking specific references to "tropical forests" and expanding the scope of resources covered under the act. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include protection for coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Amendments involve expanding the scope of resources covered under the act by replacing specific references to "tropical forests" with broader terms. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include protection for coral reefs. References to "tropical forests" are replaced with "tropical forest or coral reef" to broaden the scope of resources covered under the act. The term "coral" is defined to include various species of the phylum Cnidaria. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include protection for coral reefs, defining coral as various species of the phylum Cnidaria. The term "coral reef" is defined as any reef primarily composed of coral, and "associated coastal marine ecosystem" refers to ecosystems important for maintaining the ecological integrity of coral reefs. SEC. 4 of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to change the name of the facility from "Tropical Forest Facility" to "Conservation Facility". This change is reflected in various sections of the Act. Any reference to the "Tropical Forest Facility" in other laws or documents will now be deemed as a reference to the "Conservation Facility". SEC. 5 amends the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act to include coral reef eligibility for benefits. SEC. 6 addresses U.S. government representation on oversight bodies for grants related to debt-for-nature swaps and debt buybacks. Section 808(a)(5) of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to allow individuals appointed by the United States Government to serve on the administering body overseeing grants from debt-for-nature swaps or debt buybacks. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename agreements and eliminate the requirement to consult with the Enterprise for the Americas Board. The role of beneficiary countries is also revised. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to prioritize projects that enhance governance and management of tropical forests and coral reefs. Grants over $250,000 require approval from the US and beneficiary country governments. Technical amendments are also made. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is further amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Amendments also specify requirements for projects dependent on tropical forests or coral reefs. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Amendments also update definitions to reflect conservation agreements. SEC. 8. CONSERVATION FUND. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename the fund and agreement to "Conservation Fund" and "Conservation Agreement" respectively. Definitions are updated to reflect these changes. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename the fund and agreement to "Conservation Fund" and "Conservation Agreement" respectively. Definitions are updated to reflect these changes, including replacing "Tropical Forest Fund" with "Conservation Fund" in specific sections. SEC. 9 repeals the authority of the Enterprise for the Americas Board to carry out activities under the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009. SEC. 10 changes the due dates of annual reports to Congress. SEC. 10 amends the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 by changing the due dates of annual reports to Congress. SEC. 11 amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 regarding the International Monetary Fund criterion for country eligibility. It removes references to exceptional circumstances and emphasizes the implementation of sound macroeconomic policies. SEC. 12 authorizes new appropriations for debt reduction and expenses related to audit, evaluation, monitoring, and administration. Section 806 of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Additionally, $300,000 is authorized for audits, evaluations, monitoring, and administration of programs under this act.
